title: Google\Cloud\Container\V1\NodePool
name: NodePool
description:
NodePool contains the name and configuration for a cluster's node pool.

Node pools are a set of nodes (i.e. VM's), with a common configuration and specification, under the control of the cluster master. They may have a set of Kubernetes labels applied to them, which may be used to reference them during pod scheduling. They may also be resized up or down, to accommodate the workload.

Generated from protobuf message google.container.v1.NodePool

params.description: The node configuration of the pool.

params.name: data.initial_node_count
params.description: The initial node count for the pool. You must ensure that your Compute Engine resource quota is sufficient for this number of instances. You must also have available firewall and routes quota.

params.description: [Output only] Server-defined URL for the resource.

params.name: data.version
params.description: The version of the Kubernetes of this node.

params.name: data.instance_group_urls
params.description: [Output only] The resource URLs of the managed instance groups associated with this node pool.

params.name: data.status
params.description: [Output only] The status of the nodes in this pool instance.

params.name: data.status_message
params.description: [Output only] Additional information about the current status of this node pool instance, if available.

params.name: data.autoscaling
params.description: Autoscaler configuration for this NodePool. Autoscaler is enabled only if a valid configuration is present.

params.name: data.management
params.description: NodeManagement configuration for this NodePool.
